intro: Erysimum serpillifolium, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers. It has basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Erysimum serpillifolium is often found in alpine or arctic environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
